summary.long: Obadiah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text:
Obadiah’s vision: 
This is what the Lord God has to say about Edom.
We have heard a report from the Lord,
    and a messenger has been dispatched among the nations to say
“Get up! Let us rise up against her to fight!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look! I will make you insignificant among the nations;
    you will be utterly despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrogance in your heart has deceived you,
    who inhabit hidden places on rocky cliffs,
    whose dwelling is in the heights,
    who say continuously to yourself,
        ‘Who will bring me down to the ground?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though you soar high like the eagle
    and make your nest among the stars,
I will bring you down even from there,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If thieves came against you,
    if marauding gangs by night
        —Oh, how you will be destroyed!—
Would they not steal only until they had enough?
If grape pickers came to you,
    would they not leave some grapes to be gleaned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Oh, how Esau is ransacked,
    how his hidden treasures are thoroughly searched out!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your allies will force you out of the land,
    your associates will deceive you and prevail against you.
Your friends will lay out a trap for you,
    and you will never understand it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In that day,” declares the Lord,
    “will I not destroy the wise from Edom,
    and those with understanding from Esau’s Mountain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teman, our mighty soldiers will be dismayed,
    so that every man from Esau’s Mountain will be slaughtered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Shame will overwhelm you
    because of the violence you inflicted on your brother Jacob,
and you will be excluded forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“On the day you just stood by,
when strangers carried away Jacob’s wealth
and foreigners entered his gates,
    casting lots for Jerusalem,
you were just like one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You should not have gloated over your brother,
    on the day of his calamity.
You should not have rejoiced
    when the descendants of Judah were perishing.
You should not have boasted
    when they were in distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You should not have entered the gate of my people
    on the day of their disaster.
Also, you should not have gloated over Judah’s misfortune
    on the day of his disaster,
nor should you have plundered his wealth
    on the day of his disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you should not have taken your stand at the crossroads
    to cut down his fleeing refugees,
nor should you have handed over his survivors
    on the day of his distress.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Indeed, the Day of the Lord approaches all nations.
    As you have done it will be done to you—
        your deeds will return to haunt you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just as you have drunk from the cup of my wrath upon my holy mountain,
    so will all nations drink from the cup of my wrath perpetually.
They will drink, they will gulp it down,
    and they will be as if they had never existed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But there will be a delivered remnant on Mount Zion.
    There will be holiness,
        and the house of Jacob will take back their possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The house of Jacob will be a fire,
and the house of Joseph a flame,
    but the house of Esau will be kindling.
Then Jacob and Joseph will burn and consume Esau,
    and no survivor will remain from the house of Esau.”
Indeed, the Lord has spoken it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Those in the Negev will possess Esau’s Mountain,
    and those in the Shephelah the Philistines.
They will possess the fields of Ephraim
    and the fields of Samaria,
while Benjamin will possess the territory of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The exiles, the Israeli host,
    will possess the territory of the Canaanites all the way to Zarephath.
The exiles of Jerusalem who are in Sepharad
    will possess the cities of the Negev.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliverers will assemble on Mount Zion to judge Esau’s Mountain,
    and to the Lord will the kingdom belong!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
